title: Unable to Open containers
content: Hello, I want to be able to use containers when using Mozilla. I followed the instructions from the support article Multi-Account Containers link here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/containers but was unable to do anything other than install the extension. I have no access to a containers icon despite looking in my toolbox, settings, and extensions. When I click on tabs I am unable to put tabs into containers despite following the presented instructions. I also find that in settings I have the message "Firefox Multi-Account Containers requires container tabs". I thought that downloading the extension would allow for container tabs but I am unable to even find the option to open containers. I've attached some images to provide context as to what I am seeing. Any help you could provide would be greatly appreciated.
creator: jmkamholz

title: Printing PDF
content:
When printing a PDF with custom page ranges, the footer text in the print preview (see image) does not match the actual page. As shown in the example image, if I want to print pages 2-16, the preview indicating page 4 is actually page 5.

So, if I want to print with a very custom range, such as 2-4, 6-10, 12-14, 16, it will be very confusing and will take longer to adjust.

And I also print custom ranges like this very often for daily tasks. I’m not sure if this is a bug or just a minor adjustment needed in Firefox’s coding. Thank you in advance for your help.
creator: desri182

title: Confusion in "send Tab to device" when Firefox Desktop synced with two iPhone15.
content: Hi, My Firefox desktop is synced using Mozilla account with two iPhone-15 Firefox for iOS browsers perfectly. Individually I have no problems sending to and fro the tabs from desktop to iPhone and vice versa. When there are two iPhones involved (say work and personal iPhones), trouble arises. Problem#1: why does Firefox continue to refer to my iPhone-15 whose name is "ABC iPhone15" as merely "iPhone"? Thereby when I send my tabs to my device it will be "Firefox on iPhone". It should be "Firefox on ABC iPhone15" Problem#2: Confusion furthers when there are two iPhone-15 synced with the FF Desktop. Both continue to be referred to as "Firefox on iPhone". How would I know which one is the personal versus work iPhone?
creator: arunkumarvedavyasan

title: Turn off auto import bookmarks/passwords when reinstalling
content: Hello, I accidentally imported/synced bookmarks and password information from one of my Google accounts that I did not mean to; I have two accounts “person 1” and “person 2” and I only wanted to sync person 1’s information. so I wanted to remove/turn off the imported bookmarks and saved password information to “person 2” and I can’t seem to find out how to do that. I tried uninstalling and reinstalling Firefox but now every time I do that it automatically imports all the saved information for both Google accounts, even when I click to restore default settings it auto imports after that. How can I make it so this does not happen, I would like to just start with a clean slate.
